newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks end up 1.14 pct on foreign buying.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks end up 1.14 pct on foreign buying.

text.p: Thai stocks rallied 1.14 percent on speculative foreign buying of major bank and energy issues ahead of long weekend holidays, brokers said.
"Foreigners bought discounted banks and energy issues, reasoning their business would be less affected by the prevailing economic slump," said Somchai Trairattanapirom of SITCA Investment.
The composite SET index closed rising 8.08 points to 714.09 on 3.4 billion baht turnover.
The SET-50 index gained 0.87 point to 53.55.
Advances edged declines 150 to 137 with 97 issues ending unchanged.
Brokers said foreigners continued accumulating stocks while local investors were sidelined by the upcoming long weekend.
Foreigners were net buyers by 875 million baht on Thursday.
The market will be closed on Monday for a public holiday.
Brokers said an announcement by three finance firms to merge and apply for a new commercial banking licence on Thursday would benefit the market.
The firms planning to form an alliance are Nava Finance and Securities Plc, Thaimex Finance and Securities Plc, and CMIC Finance and Securities.
Bangkok Bank topped the active list, gaining two baht to 189, and PTT Exploration rose 18 to 340.
